page.title: 07The Manor House
page.content: Dunston is one of the few villages that are privileged to have a house built by a Prime Minister.The house is owned by Mr Higginbotton and is called the Manor House,although the first Manor House for the area was in Nocton. The house was inherited by Frederick John Robinson on the death of his wife's father (who was the Fourth Earl of Buckinghamshire) in 1816.Robinson later became Prime Minister from August 1827 to January 1828. In 1972 a woodworm infested staircase was removed from the Manor House on the reverse side of one step was writen William Bavin Joiner of Dunston erected this staircase on November 13th 1824 and rebuilt this house in 1824.
